title: Basic NE
content:
[Neurological examination]
E4V5M6, alert
Pupil reflex 3+/3+
EOM full, VF intact, ptosis(-), nystagmus(-)
Facial sensation: onion skin normal, light touch symmetrical
Facial palsy(-)
Tongue deviation(-)
Dysarthria(-)
[Muscle power]
RUL5, RLL5, LUL5, LLL5
DTR: L4 ++/++
Babinski(R/L): withdraw/withdraw
FNF: no dysmetria
HKS: no dysmetria
Light touch: intact
Pinprick: intact

title: MG ADL
content:
[MG-ADL 評估]

1. 說話 (Talking) (0) 正常 (1) 輕微構音不全或說話疲勞 (2) 明顯構音不全或聲音沙啞 (3) 嚴重到難以理解或無法說話

2. 咀嚼 (Chewing) (0) 正常 (1) 咀嚼固體食物（如肉）時輕微無力或疲勞 (2) 明顯咀嚼無力，需改吃軟質食物 (3) 無法咀嚼固體食物

3. 吞嚥 (Swallowing) (0) 正常 (1) 輕微吞嚥困難或偶爾嗆到 (2) 明顯吞嚥困難，需軟質食物 (3) 無法吞嚥（需鼻胃管）

4. 呼吸 (Breathing) (0) 正常 (1) 輕微呼吸急促（通常僅在費力活動時） (2) 明顯呼吸急促，影響日常活動 (3) 嚴重呼吸困難（休息時也喘）或需呼吸輔助

5. 刷牙或梳頭 (Brushing teeth or combing hair) (0) 正常 (1) 輕微手臂無力或疲勞 (2) 明顯手臂無力，執行困難或需要休息 (3) 無法完成動作

6. 從椅子上站起來 (Rising from a chair) (0) normal (1) 輕微困難 (2) 明顯困難，通常需要使用手臂輔助 (3) 沒有他人協助無法自行站起

7. 複視 (Double vision) (0) 無 (1) 輕微（短暫、不頻繁） (2) 明顯（頻繁或持續，影響日常活動） (3) 嚴重（持續且造成生活失能）

8. 眼瞼下垂 (Eyelid droop) (0) 無 (1) 輕微下垂，不影響視線 (2) 明顯下垂，稍微影響視線 (3) 嚴重下垂，已遮蔽視線

總分： _____ / 24

title: Polyneuropathy findings
content:
Findings:
Motor NCS: Prolonged distal latencies in upper and lower limbs with slowed conduction velocities, more pronounced in the legs. Reduced CMAP amplitudes in bilateral lower limbs.
Sensory NCS: Prolonged distal latencies in upper and lower limbs. Reduced SNAP amplitudes in both upper and lower limbs.
Prolonged F-wave latencies.
Prolonged H-reflexes.

Impression:
Generalized, symmetric, length-dependent sensorimotor polyneuropathy with predominantly demyelinating features and superimposed axonal loss (lower limbs more severe).

Correlation with clinical course and labs (e.g., diabetes/uremia/B12, paraproteinemia, immune-mediated etiologies such as CIDP) is recommended.

title: S.H Wang MD/ T.H. KO M.D.
content: S.H Wang MD/ T.H. KO M.D.

title: suspicious of autonomic dysfunction
content:
R-Rinterval Report:
R-R interval values: (Min: 60 Max: 73 Mean: 65 SD: 3.0 Variance:18.7 %)

Findings and Conclusion:
SSR study is absent on the four limbs.
The R-R interval showed 18.7% variance during this study.
Interpretations:
There was suspicious of autonomic dysfunction during this study.
Please correlate with clinical presentations and further investigations.

title: 00516732 Sensorimotor polyneuropathy, mixed with axonal and demyelinating changes
content:
Findings:
1. Prolonged distal latencies of motor NCV at upper and lower limbs. Reduced CMAP amplitudes at bilateral lower limbs
2. Prolonged distal latencies of sensory NCV at upper and lower limbs. Reduced SNAP amplitudes at bilateral upper and lower limbs
3. Prolongation of F-wave latency
4. Prolongation of H-reflex latency

Impression: Sensorimotor polyneuropathy, mixed with axonal and demyelinating changes

Recommendation: Correlate clinically and follow-up

S.H Wang MD/ T.H. KO M.D.

title: VBI 模板
content:
B mode: Shallow plaque on bilateral carotid bulb

Color Doppler: Normal flow Doppler signals of bilateral carotid.
The total vertebral flow volume ( R + L = 42.2 + 56.9 ml/min, total 99.1) is lower than normal limits
Impression:
Mild to moderate atherosclerotic changes at bilateral carotid bulb region without significant hemodynamic changes.
Decreased total vertebral flow is compatible with vertebrobasilar insufficiency.
Recommendation: Correlate clinically and follow-up later as indicated

S.H Wang MD/ T.H. KO M.D.

title: Normal P100
content:
Findings and Conclusion:

Normal P100 latency by bilateral optic stimulation

Impression: Normal VEP study
Recommendation: Clinical correlation and follow-up

S.H Wang MD/ T.H. KO M.D.

title: 左耳完全hearing loss
content:
Findingsand Conclusion:

Right side study shows normal waveform and wave I, II, III, V are WNL; moreover, interval of wave I-III & III-V are WNL.

Left side study shows absence of wave I, II, III, V.

Impression: Left side peripheral auditoy pathway dysfunction
Recommendation: Clinical correlation and follow up

S.H Wang MD/ T.H. KO M.D.

content:
Muscle power :

 - Lower limbs (R/L) 5/5
